fields.description: Since we have the possibility to have icons for the request types, It would be logical to have this also for the request type groups in the customer portal.
fields.summary: Customer portal - Custom Request Type Icons

fields.description:
This stem from our users base multiple feedback would be good to be able to share and pull in users from their group or another group.

Use case 1:  Eng user found a system config has issue and open a JSD ticket.  Want to include the entire eng group that is waiting on the fix.  Like to have a way to easily share the ticket with them, so when the ticket is resolved, all impacted are notified.

Use case 2: A user submitted a ticket capture one aspect of the issue and want to pull in another group to add details to the ticket.

JSD/Jira has the concept of groups, it would be nice be able to setup up groups that can be used  for share or request participants actions.
fields.summary: JSD share / request participants have a way to add a group of customers/users
diffrence between two APIs

fields.description:
h3. _(Note that this behavior is intermittent, so it's not always reproducible)_

When viewing an issue in the new view, sometimes the SLA information goes all the way down and gets hidden, only becoming visible when clicking on 'Show more'
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Open any issue in the new issue view

h3. Expected results

SLA information is displayed below the status
 !sla.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual result

SLA information is hidden in 'Show more'

!slas.gif!
h3. Workaround

View the issue from the queue (the behavior won't happen using the queue URL)
fields.summary: SLA panel is hidden in 'Show more' in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Duplicate email accounts are allowed across different projects.

h3. Expected behaviour:
Email account should be unique

h3. Screenshot:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround:
Don't use uppercase for email account
fields.summary: Duplicate email accounts are allowed across different projects

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It's inconvenient that the project admin has to find the corresponding create screen when they want to add fields.

h3. Suggested Solution

Place a button which links to the create screen like https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ConfigureFieldScreen.jspa?id=10001 in the modal.

 !Screenshot 2019-08-30 10.28.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Place a link to the create screen in the "Add a field" modal

fields.description:
Project A has a time to first response of 1 hour. Project B has a time to first response of 30 minutes. A ticket is created in Project A and the SLA starts counting down. After 15 minutes, the ticket is moved to Project B. The SLA does not reset, which means it's now 15 minutes into a 30 minute timer. 

When a ticket is moved from one service desk project to another, SLA's should be reset, just as if the ticket was newly created in the destination project.
fields.summary: Reset SLA when issue is moved to another Service Desk project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Assets from uninstalled apps still show up as possible field options when linking assets to Jira issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect your Jira Service Desk with an Asset Management tool.
# Create a few options.
# Uninstall the Asset Management tool and install another one.
# Click on +Link assets.

h3. Expected Results

Only assets from the currently installed app will be retrieved as possible options.

h3. Actual Results

Assets from the uninstalled app are also retrieved.

h3.Workaround
No workaround so far.
fields.summary: Assets from uninstalled apps still appear as a field option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6110].
  {panel}
h3. Problem
Currently, Customer Request type field is locked in Jira and cannot be used as mandatory when moving/creating a ticket or other issue actions.

h3. Suggested resolution

It would be useful if we could have the functionality to make Customer Request type field required when moving/creating the tickets.
fields.summary: Possibility to make Customer Request type required when moving/creating a ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? See the corresponding suggestion.
{panel}
h3. Problem definition

Request type is always _No match_ if
 * the issue has been created directly in JIRA
 * the issue type has changed by editing this field (same workflow)
 * the issue type has changed by moving the ticket (same project but different workflows)
 * the ticket has been moved between different Service Desk projects

h3. Suggested solution

Automatically update the request type corresponding to its issue type
h3. Workaround

If the Move operation involves status changing, you can use the workaround below:
 # The Request type _Heartware problem_ is associated with the Issue type _Problem_.
 # Create an automation rule like the one below and include all existing request types and issue types. 
 ** [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/automatically-set-customer-request-type-when-issue-is-moved-or-created-via-jira-1026039858.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/automatically-set-customer-request-type-when-issue-is-created-via-jira-859463969.html]
fields.summary: Update Request Type automatically when issue is moved to different project or different workflow

fields.description:
How can I set a custom reply-to mail address for the notifications that are send out by Jira Service Desk.

I have found that under Project > Notifications, I can set a custom email address (for a domain that is off course fully verified) but that only modifies the from-address.  

The reply-to mail address is still the standard cloud collector email email address although the expectation is that it mimics the from-address as set specifically
fields.summary: Set custom reply-to address for Jira Service Desk notifications

fields.description:
In our setup JSD is able to receive emails and creating tickets for everybody that email our support emailaddress.  When that happens the customer is automatically added to the list of customers (and if we like to can group them into organisations) but in any case they can be filled from now on in the 'reporter'-field or 'participants'-field when we manually create a ticket for them. 

However when a customer call our support and has not send any mails to our support mailbox before, then of course they don't exist as a customer.  We want to register a new ticket for that customer too and would like to add them as the 'reporter', so from now on they receive updates when we comment on the ticket (and at the same time to learn about our support mailaddress)

However that cannot be done since when setting a reporter or participant that user needs to be in the customer list already, which is not that logical and very unhandy .
fields.summary: Creating a new ticket for a new customer without having to add the customer first

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When visiting the Automation page for a project, there exists the ability to set the Project default. When trying to change this to someone else, you must type in their name despite the field appearing to be a dropdown.

h3. Suggested Solution
Populate the dropdown with a list of eligible users.

h3. Workaround
Type in the name of an eligible user.
fields.summary: Automation configuration shows a dropdown, but doesn't populate names

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After uninstalling an addon which sets up assets, the assets tied to that addon are still present.

h3. Suggested Solution
After uninstalling an addon which sets up assets, the assets should be able to be hidden or removed.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to delete or hide Linked assets after addon is uninstalled

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When the customer portal is open to the public (login free portal), Jira will show suggested forms in the very first page.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-28 at 14.44.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Resolution
Have the ability to remove or hide the "Suggested Forms" section when the portal is set to login free.
fields.summary: Ability to remove/hide the "Suggested Forms" from the portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Automation rules that should be executed by SLA triggers (SLA breached, for example) are silently failing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1 - Create an SLA. E.g: "Time waiting for Customer Response".
2 - Create an Automation rule like the following:
{panel}- When: SLA Breached - "Time waiting for Customer Response"
- IF: Any Issue
- Then: Transition Issue - Resolve.{panel}
3 - Create an issue and wait for the SLA to breach.

h3. Expected Results

When the SLA breaches, the issue should be transitioned to "Resolved".

h3. Actual Results

The SLA breached event will not trigger the automation rule. The issue will not transition and nothing is displayed on the automation logs.
 

h3. Notes

- The issue is intermittent
- Other automation rules do not seem to be impacted by the bug.
- Similar bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5564

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: SLA dependent automation rules are intermittently failing

fields.description:
h3. Summary Incoming emails are including commented hidden HTML tags from the html email body header tags in the comments section. These have been inserted by templates used to generate email signatures. h3. Environment Jira Service Desk Cloud h3. Steps to Reproduce # Write an email and insert a template generated signature that adds HTML comments in the head tags of the HTML email body. # Send the email to the incoming email address for Jira Service Desk h3. Expected Results Any HTML contained inside *<-- -->* HTML comment tags should not be displayed in the issue view. h3. Actual Results The HTML comments are displayed in the comments on the issue view. Here is an example HTML email body which causes this, note the comment in the section, this is what is displayed on the issue view. {code:html}

Email body Text 😊

 

Testmail #1

 

Text
Text



Text
Text. 20
Text
Text
 
Phone  +49 8225 996-1052
Fax  +49 8225 996-41052
Text
URL  
 

Text
Sitz der Gesellschaft: Jettingen-Scheppach
Text Memmingen
Some Text

Some text
This e-mail and any files transmitted with it are confidential intended solely for the use of the addressee!



 

{code} h3. Notes This only occurs when commenting on an issue not creating one. h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk is displaying hidden HTML comments from emails that are part of generated templates for email signatures

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Request type icons do not render in filter subscription email.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter > Set "Request type" field in the list
 # Add filter subscription
 # Edit the subscription > Select "Run now"
 # Check filter in email

h3. Expected Results

The emailed filter should contain the "Request type" field icons.

h3. Actual Results

Request type icons do not apper. Appear as:


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Request type icons do not render in filter subscription email

fields.description: I would like to be able to use, create, and store canned responses in Jira Service Desk Cloud without the use of an add-on.
fields.summary: Canned Responses in Jira Service Desk

fields.description: As a user it would be helpful to be able to create automation rules with the ability to use conditional logic operators to save time and make the rules more useful.
fields.summary: Add Conditional Logic Operators to Automations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the user exports an issue from Jira to CSV (all fields) or CSV (Current fields) the "Customer Request type" does not match the actual request type in the ticket, instead, it shows a different request type.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Search for tickets where the request type is not empty;
{code}"Request Type" is not EMPTY{code}
# Click on Export Excel CSV (all fields) or CSV (Current fields).

h3. Expected results

The CSV is exported with the request type of the ticket.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-27 at 11.32.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

The CSV is exported with a wrong request type.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-27 at 11.26.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: "Customer Request type" is wrongly exported in CSV

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Articles displayed in the customer portal are displaying different than the same articles in Confluence. For example, images and placed differently.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow articles in the customer portal to use the same CSS as what is used in Confluence for consistency.
fields.summary: Ability to display articles in the portal the same way how it is shown in Confluence pages

fields.description:
Need to have the ability to create Kanban board for Service Desk Projects.

Customer's requirement states that it would be easier to track the progress of tickets for customer if we have a board.
fields.summary: Ability to create Kanban Board for Service Desk
Allow further customization of Customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a customer rates a request, they will be redirected to the portal to provide feedback and there is no method to turn this off.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to disable the feedback form while still being able to give rating
fields.summary: Ability to disable feedback form

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement

Currently portals are displayed on the help centre based on created date. When there are many portals, it can be difficult for customers to find the portal. 

 
h3. Proposed solution

Allow portals to be re-ordered alphabitically to make it more user friendly.
fields.summary: Ability to rearrange portals on new service desk view

fields.description:
Noticed a few minor translation mistakes in the Help Center request form
 * The "Send" button is translated to "lähettää" (translation: to send). It should be: "Lähetä".
 * "Share with" option "No one" is translated to "ei kukaan" (translation: nobody). Better translation would be: "Ei kenenkään kanssa", which would go better with the default option.
fields.summary: Better Finnish translations for two Support portal form items (Jira Service Desk Cloud)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the email password changes and Jira tries to connect to the inbox, but can't, the connection is suspended and a retry is put in place.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a JSD mail handler.
# Update the above mailbox password.
# Access Jira settings and update the password

h3. Expected Results
Credentials are updated and emails are pulled from the inbox.

h3. Actual Results
On UI is shown as successful connection, but we never reached the mail server with the new credentials provided.
 

h3.Workaround
* Delete and then recreate the email channel with the proper credentials.
fields.summary: Not able to update JSD mail handler credentials

fields.description: It would be handy to have the ability to control outgoing notifications based on the customer's email address. A business case would be to not send notifications to the customer when the sender email address is a no-reply address or service desk admin wouldn't want to send back updates to that customer.
fields.summary: Control outgoing notification on customer level
No message/adivce is displayed when deleting a request type that has a missing issue type

fields.description:
h3. Summary


Incorrect translation "requests" = "begäranden".
Correct translation "requests" = "ärenden".

Incorrect translation "Created by me" =  "skapad av mig" is singular.
Correct translation "Created by me"= "skapade av mig" for plural.

See attached screenshots.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change language to "Svenska"
# Select "My request" from top panel

h3. Expected Results

Correct translation "requests" = "ärenden".
Correct translation "Created by me"= "skapade av mig" for plural.

h3. Actual Results

Incorrect translation "requests" = "begäranden".
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
Incorrect translation "Created by me" =  "skapad av mig" is singular.

fields.summary: Incorrect Swedish translation on portal

fields.description:
In JSD Cloud next-gen projects, two fields can be configured on a request type:
* Portal description
* Portal instructions

Currently, they do not show up in the help center for those next-gen projects:
Settings:
!ng-settings.png|thumbnail! 

Help center:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

We will be looking into this bug with high priority starting tomorrow Wed 21st (Sydney time) and provide with updates on resolution.
fields.summary: [next-gen-only] Request type description / instructions not showing on the JSD Cloud Next Gen service desks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44337].
{panel}
The issue collector allows only for the issue type to be chosen when setting up the collector.
 If the issue collector is intended to be used with a Service Desk project, these issues will not show up in queues and under requests in the Service Desk itself due to the absence of a value for the request type field.

Adding the request type as a configuration option when setting up the issue collector allows for it to be used for Service Desk projects.

Additionally, if the issue collector is configured to _Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address,_ if the user does not have _Application access (license)_ and _Create issues permission_ for the project, the default issue reporter you specify in it will be used as the issue's reporter, and this means that all customers will have their issues created by the default reporter, so this restriction would also require being addressed to allow Customers using Issue collectors seamlessly for Service Desk.
fields.summary: Add request type as a configurable option to the issue collector for Service Desk projects
"All remaining issues" SLA Calendar incorrectly displayed as the "24/7 Calendar (Default)" on the Save SLA changes pop-up after editing any SLA goal.

fields.description:
h3. *The request:*

 This feature request is to request the possibility of adding an SSO button at the portal that will direct to a custom URL ( Identity provider SSO URL ) or [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/], and it should be a configuration for the JSD project to enable or disable this button, once not all customers will have this need.

h3. *Use case:*

Let's use 'Test User' to explain the scenario.

Atlassian account 'Test User' has on Atlassian site: test.user@domain.com 
 The email it uses to login in at the IdP: test@domain.com

The issue here is that when 'Test User' goes to https://<site>.atlassian.net/servicedesk and informs the email address test@domain.com it isn't redirected to SSO for authentication and the Portal request his password ( because the Atlassian account at the site is test.user@domain.com ).

This is an issue for JSD SSO customers that map different email information than the one used at the IdP for Atlassian, hence Atlassian accounts that only have access to the JSD Portal may experience issues to login once they don't know what email information should be filled at the portal.
fields.summary: SSO option at the JSD Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
If anonymous access is allowed, any customer may raise a request without logging in. Should we want to allow anyone to be able to read our portal articles for self help, they would have the ability to raise tickets without logged in to.

h3. Suggested solution
Allow the ability for anyone to access the portal articles but require login to raise requests
fields.summary: Allow anonymous access to portal but require login to raise request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, there is no notification can be configured that could remind those that are selected to be an Approver of a request. If they forget about it and that pretty much it. In addition, Automation does not have a selection to send an email or alert the approver.

h3. Suggested Solution:
For JIRA Service Desk to have a feature to remind the approvers if they did not take any action in a given time. It could be a standalone feature or include them in the automation.
fields.summary: Approval Reminder Notification

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
The customer portal login page is branded Atlassian and it is not possible to customize it.
h3. Suggested solution
Add the ability to customize the customer portal login where admins are able to add/remove the logos as required
fields.summary: Ability to customize the customer portal login page

fields.description:
Problem:

The search functionality in the knowledge base section of Jira service desk projects has the following limitations:
 * The search results are limited to 25 results max
 * Search results are ranked based on which articles have been recently modified

Suggested solutions:
 * Provide more than 25 search results to be displayed on the search page or multiple pages of search results.
 * Allow extra filtering and sorting options for the knowledge base search results. eg title, author, last modified, tags etc 
 * Let the search engine similar to what we have on Confluence, in order to improve the results of our search
fields.summary: Improve the search experience in the Knowledge base section of Jira Service Desk cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

An approver may want to approve an issue, but have it be conditional on something else happening in the future.
h3. Suggested Solution

Have a comment field to display when the approval is selected, so that the user can document that condition within the approval.
fields.summary: Comment field to be displayed underneath approval

fields.description:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The date is translated in custom reports though.
fields.summary: Selected date is not translated in Knowledge Base reports

fields.description:
hello,

 

these days we encountered random error messages in jira, cand you check please?

thanks,

!image-2019-08-14-11-12-59-029.png!

!image-2019-08-14-11-12-41-009.png!
fields.summary: random error messages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
View service desk project link available in Jira service desk portal customers section of user management redirects you to a blank page


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *User Management* > *Jira Service Desk* section to view portal customers
# Click on *View service desk projects* option from top to view available service desk projects
!Screen Shot 2019-04-23 at 6.46.16 PM.png|thumbnail!  


h3. Expected Results
It redirects you to the Browse project page with filtered service desk projects 

h3. Actual Results
It redirects to you a blank page
 
h3. Notes
This is because the button redirects you to page [https://admin.atlassian.com/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=service_desk] instead of [https://sitename.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=service_desk]

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to access the Jira application directly and go to the Projects section. Or use the correct URL [https://sitename.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=service_desk]
fields.summary: View service desk project link available in Jira service desk portal customers section of user management redirects to a blank page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, they are ordered by goals. The one with about to breach or already breached will always be at the very top. The position is unfixed.

h3. Why this is important
There are cases where the user needs to check SLA that they have involved by step in the workflow. The red colour is good enough for highlighting breached SLA so by having the SLA to reorder based on the goal might be a redundant solution. So it's preferable to have a fix position
 
h3. Workaround  
No workaround
fields.summary: Allow user to customize SLA order

fields.description:
I would like the ability to add more customizable questions to the customer satisfaction survey in Jira Service Desk, at this moment it's only possible to add one question.

!print.png|width=423,height=107!
fields.summary: Ability to Add More Questions In Customer Satisfaction Survey

fields.description:
I am writing a page:

[https://cmredevops.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/3/article/239534081?src=40541411]

On Confluence:

!image-2019-08-13-15-10-44-817.png!

On the portal no TOC:

!image-2019-08-13-15-11-30-666.png|width=324,height=221!

 

I not sure how long this issue has exited, I have never seen it work.

But I am writing more and more articles on our service desk and finding loads of bugs with this tool.
fields.summary: Table of Contents don't show up on customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a customer is newly created from the portal "Raise on behalf", a customer invited notification is sent multiple times to the customer email

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that your Service Desk allows anonymous access and the project allows "anyone" to raise a request
# Raise a request on behalf of an email which is not yet registered as a customer

h3. Expected Results
A customer invitation is sent once
h3. Actual Results
A customer invitation is sent more than once
 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Customer invited notification sent multiple times

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when adding user as a *Customer* and to an *Organization*, the user is not automatically added to the *Service Desk Customers* role. When adding the user outside of an *Organization*, they are automatically added to the *Service Desk Customers* role.

 

h3. Suggested Solution

When adding a *Customer*, whether to an *Organization* or not, automatically add them to the *Service Desk Customers* role.

h3. Workaround

Add the user as a *Customer* (without specifying an Organization) and then move them to the *Organization* afterwards.
fields.summary: Automatically add Customers to Service Desk Customers when added into an Organization

fields.description:
{panel:title=UPDATE|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#4c9aff|bgColor=#b3d4ff}
It is possible now to copy a workflow to another request type within the same project. You can pick a request type in Jira Service Desk next-gen project and click "Edit workflow" -> "Copy to other request types".

*When you copy a workflow this way, it is "shared" between request types. It would be good to copy a workflow and have an option to make it "shared" or just copy and make it a standalone workflow.*

Copying a workflow as a standalone helps to not create a complex workflow from scratch and at the same time don't have it affect other request types.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is not possible to share a request type workflow within a next-gen service desk project.
h3. Suggested Solution

The ability to share a request type workflow with another request type of the same project would be nice.
h3. Workaround

Manually create the same workflow for a different request type.
fields.summary: Ability to share or copy workflows between request types in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a service desk project has a list of customer organizations with similar names one of which contains the same characters as the others but without a unique identifier such as
{noformat}
N&B 
N&B aa
N&B aaa
N&B aaaa
N&B aaaaa
N&B aaaaaa
N&B aaaaaaa
N&B bb
N&B bbb
N&B abbb
N&B abbbb
N&B abbbbb
N&B abbbbbb
etc...
{noformat}

Due to the way results are returned when searching for an organization in either the old or new issue view it is not guaranteed that the group {{N&B}} will display in the list of results when *N&B* is entered into the organization field on the issue. As such there is no way to select this organization. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
_NB: This may be hard to replicate due to inconsistency of the order of returned organization results when typing in the name_
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Add at least 20 organizations using a similar naming convention as above. 
# Create an ticket in the service desk project. 
# Try and assign the "base" level organization to the ticket. 

h3. Expected Results
Even if this organization is not listed in the results the name should be able to entered directly.

h3. Actual Results
Since the organization is not listed in the results and there is no way to further narrow down the search due to the organization not having any further unique identifier this organization is not selectable. 

h3. Workaround
Rename the organization to have a unique identifier following the part it has in common with the organizations.
fields.summary: Unable to add a customer organization to a ticket if the name does not display in search results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Currently there is no way to re-order the articles added in the "Catergory" created under Knowledge base of a service desk project

h3. Proposed solution
Provide a way to re-order the articles within a Knowledge base catergory
fields.summary: Ability to reorder articles in Knowledge base

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Admin can't view customer (with Atlassian Account) profile if the customer has no product access. The link directed to "People" link page and it show "Something went wrong"

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as project agent or administrator
# Open Customer list page.
# Click the customer account (make sure it have Atlassian Account)


h3. Expected Results
Admin able to view the customer profile.

h3. Actual Results
The link directed to "People" link page and it show "Something went wrong"
 !Screenshot 2019-08-12 at 5.07.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Unable to view Customer (with Atlassian Account) Profile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Based on [Manage how workflows in your next-gen service desk|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/manage-how-work-flows-in-your-next-gen-service-desk/] , only user with *Administrator* role will able to edit workflow. However, now user with *Agent* role able to open and edit the workflow, but can't Save it. By right, they shouldn't able to edit it.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as Agent of the JIRA Service Desk next-gen project
# Go to *Project Settings > Edit workflow*
# Edit the workflow and Save it.

h3. Expected Results
Agent is not able to edit the workflow at the first place.

h3. Actual Results
Agent able to edit the workflow and can't save it.

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
If the agent needs to edit the workflow, give him the "Administrator" role. For the agent, no workaround to off this behavior.
fields.summary: Agent able to open and edit request type workflow but can't save it

fields.description:
Editing agent notification schemes is not yet available in next-gen (for example: configuring a notification scheme that will alert agents on issue creation) but you can achieve this with automation rules.

 

*Work around*

Please refer to this community post [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-questions/Next-gen-Service-Desk-Issue-Created-Notifications/qaq-p/1136149] or download the attached PDF as a work around and see below screen.

Disclaimer: You have to maintain the user list in the automation setting.

!agent-notification-automation.png!
fields.summary: Configuring agent notifications

fields.description:
Jira Service Desk next gen does not allow you to set an outbound email like the Classic JSD did, eg JSD next-gen supports e-mail delivery only from jira@<yourdomain>.atlassian.net .

You would still be able to receive tickets in the system through your custom e-mail address but customers would receive ticket information with the jira@<yourdomain>.atlassian.net signature.

The below screen does not exist in JSD next-gen  

!outoing-email-classic.png!
fields.summary: Outgoing email address configuration

fields.description:
h3. Incomplete Portal translation
Fields like *Raise this request on behalf of*, *What can we help you with?* are not translated to the default project Language set on the project.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to replicate:
* Go to the Project Settings of the JSD project
* Language Support
* Select a Language other than English as the Default Language.
* Access the Customer Portal for the project.
* Try creating the issue 
* Observe that most of the fields are not translated.

h3. Expected result
The fields like *Raise this request on behalf of*,  *What can we help you with?*  are also translated.

h3. Current result
The fields like *Raise this request on behalf of*,  *What can we help you with?*  are not translated.

h3. Workaround
Ask the user to set the user's preferred language to the required Language.
This will translate the whole Portal accordingly.
fields.summary: Incomplete Portal translation

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The recent changes to the custom email configuration form for the Service Desk at https://instance.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/pkey/email-settings do not allow users to specify a username as part of the email server login anymore. This prevents users from being able to use group mailboxes which can only be signed in to via pop using the username with the following structure:

user@domain.com\groupmailbox@domain.com

h3. Suggested resolution

Bring back the username functionality.
fields.summary: Bring back the username functionality on the email requests configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a KB article contains a video file, this will play fine in Confluence, but will not playback through the portal view of the customer.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page in a Confluence space that is linked as a KB
# Add a short video
# View the article from the portal

h3. Expected Results

The video should play fine in Jira SD

h3. Actual Results

 

h3. Notes
The tests were made using an mp4 format video.


h3.Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Not able to view video in Knowledgebase

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Recently, JSD release a new feature whereby customer able to add the domain to permitted domain list in email request configuration. This is to allow "bulk, auto-reply and etc" email that will be rejected by JSD email request. By adding the domain to the permitted list, it will get process successfully. However, now the permitted emails are logged twice if when they're picked up by the email request process filter

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Project Settings > Email Request*
# Click the three dots button > Managed Allow list
# Add the specific domain
# Send email from the domain with "Auto-Submitted" header.

h3. Expected Results
Email get process successfully and from the email request log only shows one logged, which is successful.

h3. Actual Results
Email get process successfully and a ticket created. However, from the email request logs, it shows two log which is one is successful and one failed.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Permitted emails are logged twice if they're picked up by the email request process filter

fields.description:
*Problem:*

As a service desk agent, I want to write and organize my knowledge in one place without having to switch context. 

*Suggested solution:*

The ability to associate a confluence page to a knowledge base category from the confluence page, using a button or applying tags.
fields.summary: Manage knowledge base categories from confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Customers table is sorted by "name", which makes it hard to find relevant customers.
h3. Suggested solution

Customers table should have the ability to sort by other attributes e.g. "open requests" and "closed requests".
fields.summary: Ability to sort customers table

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary No error on the Email Request configuration when field beside Summary and Description is set to required for request types h3. Steps to Reproduce # (Optionally) remove all the request type to isolate this case and create a new Request Type. # On the request type, *include the Summary and Description field* to have Email Request to work # Add another field and Set the field to *required* # Go to *Email Request* and click "Turn on email support" h3. Expected Results Error message explaining how to set up a suitable Request Type should be displayed h3. Actual Results Clicking on the button does nothing The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file: From the Browser's network request console: {code} { "errors": [ { "errorMessage": "To receive requests by email, you must have a request type with visible Summary and Description fields. All other request type fields must be optional. You can create a new request type or modify an existing one here." } ], "reasonKey": "sd.email.ondemand.mailbox.creation.failure.no.valid.request.type", "reasonCode": "400" } {code} h3. Workaround Have at least one Request Type to include Summary and Description, field and other field should be set as optional in order to have the email request to work
fields.summary: No error on the Email Request configuration when field beside Summary and Description is set to required for request types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to update JSD mail handler credentials

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a JSD mail handler.
# Update the above mailbox password.
# Access Jira settings and update the password

h3. Expected Results
# Credentials updated

h3. Actual Results
On UI is shown as successful connection, but we never reached the mail server with the new credentials provided.
 

h3.Workaround
Delete and then recreate the email channel with the proper credentials.
fields.summary: Not able to update JSD mail handler credentials

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira Service Desk Cloud will allow you to link with a Confluence space in order to serve customers with a knowledgebase.  Currently though this feature requires that both Service Desk and Confluence applications exist in the same Cloud site (with the same Cloud domain name: example.atlassian.net for instance).  The documentation in [Link a Confluence space to your service desk|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/link-a-confluence-space-to-your-service-desk/] confirms this.  
Right now, it's not possible to link a JSD on example.atlassian.net with a Confluence space found on sample.atlassian.net , even if you have an application link created there, and have permissions to do so.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if this integration could be implemented with two different Cloud sites, or one Cloud site and one Server site.

h3. Why this is important
Easier integrations for users spread across different platforms
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently this feature is only available to Cloud sites where Confluence and JSD are on the same site
fields.summary: Integrating Jira Service Desk with Confluence should allow you to link between Cloud sites with different domains

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when admin tried to edit the custom email request, automatically at the "Email" field will show warning symbol beside their email. There's admin thought there's something wrong with their email address and cause confusion. But actually their email is working fine and it just indicate to update the email field. Refer the screenshot below for more context:-
 !Screenshot 2019-08-07 at 9.08.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide context on the warning symbol.

h3. Why this is important
It makes confusion for the administrator.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Provide context on warning symbol displaying at the Email field for "Email Request" new configuration page

fields.description:
h3.Issue
The field Epic link greyed out when creating a Custom Automation to create a linked issue.
The Issue only affects the NextGen Service desk projects.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
* Create a next-gen service desk project 
* Go to Automation
* Create a Custom Rule
* Select an Action and *Then Do this --> Create issue*
* Select a Software project where the linked issue has to be created
* Make sure that the Epic link is added in the create screen and edit screen of the software project.
* We can observe that the epic link is greyed out.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected result
The field epic link should be editable

h3. Current result
The filed Epic link is greyed out.

h3. Workaround
No workaround in place for now
fields.summary: The field Epic link greyed out  when creating a Custom Automation to create a linked issue . Affects only Next Gen Service desk project.

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
* When subscribing to a filter that contains the Satisfaction field in its results, the value (1 to 5 stars) of the Satisfaction field is not shown in the mail.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Issue navigator, make a search
# Include the Field 'Satisfaction' in the columns visible.
# Save the Filter.
# Subscribe to the filter.

h5. Expected Behavior
* An email is received containing the Filter results at the time the subscription mail was sent, including the Satisfaction field values.

h5. Actual Behavior
* An email is received containing the Filter results at the time the subscription mail was sent, but the Satisfaction value appears empty. See example:
** Filter:  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
** Mail received:   !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Satisfaction rate not showing in mails sent from Filter Subscriptions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The request counter in the Customer Portal is not updated when a request is created or resolved
h3. Environment
Customer Portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Raise a request in the customer portal

h3. Expected Results
The request counter increases by one
h3. Actual Results
The request counter remains at it's previous value
 
h3. Notes
The same behavior is seen when a request is resolved as well where the counter does not reduce

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page
fields.summary: Requests counter in Customer Portal is not updated when a ticket is created/resolved

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an Atlassian account Customer logs in to the Service Desk Portal, they'll receive a message indicating that "Your group uses single sign-on." where the User may not belong to any Group and/or does not have SSO:

 !image-2019-08-05-17-43-47-233.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the messaging to indicate that the User cannot log in at this location and must go to the Atlassian ID login in order to log in

h3. Why this is important
As more Customer accounts are converted to or are created as [Atlassian account Customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html], the login screen should be updated and provide a more accurate message about where the User will be logging in from 
 
h3. Workaround 
As an Atlassian account Customer, follow the prompts to login on the Atlassian ID page in order to access the Service Desk Portal
fields.summary: Update Atlassian account Customer Portal Login Message

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Jira Service Desk Customer's REST API endpoint is incorrectly retrieving Agents.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Service Desk Project
# Set the customer permission to "People my team adds to the project"
# Go to the Project's people page and add an Agent to the project.
# Access the customer page of the project.
# Hit the Customer's API endpoint (https://site.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/<Project_key>/customer)

h3. Expected Results

Both should retrieve the same results.

h3. Actual Results

While the customer page correctly returns the list of customers, the API endpoint also retrieves SD Agents and Project Administrators.
 

h3.Workaround
Use the Jira API instead, filtering by the Service Desk Customers project role id.
- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-role-id-get
fields.summary: Customers REST API endpoint retrieves incorrect results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-191].
{panel}
h3. Problem

In our setup, we have a Service Desk project per customer. Most of the TEST setup (like workflow, calendars & standard offered SLA metrics) are the same for all projects, while other aspects (users/project roles/...) are specific for each TEST project.

Having tens of TEST projects, means each time the same SLAsetup needs to be configured manually:
 * SLA metrics
 * Calendars
 * ...

.. while other specifically generated setup is not wanted:
 * workflow
 * screens
 * issuetypes
 * ...

h3. Suggested resolution

Being able to control which defaults are used during 'create project' wizard, would be really helpful. 
 Alternatively, a clone/copy-from-existing SVD project would work as workaround -> if this were possible, we could use a template project to copy from.
fields.summary: Service Desk templates

fields.description: create Microsoft Teams add-on as you have for Jira Cloud and Jira Server, so customers would be able to create tickets directly from channels in MS teams.
fields.summary: create Microsoft Teams add-on as you have for Jira Cloud and Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When integrating Service Desk and Confluence, a space with dedicated pages for KB articles will be created. If an anchor is added to the article/page, the same will not work for customer-only accounts. If the customer taps the anchor while using Firefox, nothing will happen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Firefox, make sure to have a [Confluence and Jira Service Desk integrated|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver032/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-828800777.html] in order to work with the Knowledge Base article functions.
# Make sure that project allows unlicensed users to see the Confluence space, through the *Knowledge Base* option in the project's settings.
# Create a new page in Confluence and [add a link to an anchor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html] and also, add an anchor to the page.
# Have a customer accessing the knowledge base article in Jira Service desk and tap the link to the anchor

h3. Expected Results

The user should be properly redirected to the specific part of the page.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens, as if the link was a dead one.
 
h3. Notes

* For licensed users in Confluence, if they tap the anchor in the Knowledge Base article, it will properly work. This only happens for customer-only accounts.
* If the user creates an anchor to a different page, [this bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-7551] will be triggered.

h3.Workaround
* As a customer-only, open the link in a new tab. Although it will not render the page exactly as the Knowledge Base formatting, it will redirect the user to the specific part of the page.
* Use a different browser.
fields.summary: Clicking an anchor link within a Knowledge base article does not work for customers in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Currently, it's not possible to define the security level for portal only customers' password.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Create a feature where you could configure the security requirements for the customer passwords.

h3. *Why this is important*

It would improve the security of the portal.
fields.summary: Include password policy configuration for portal only customers.

fields.description:
{panel:title=18 Sept 2019 update}
Fix for this bug has been rolled out. Here's a summary of the changes:
 * Pagination is fixed
 * Organization members are now ordered by their accountId
 * Performance improvement on instance with large number of users
 * {{name}} and {{key}} fields are no longer returned
 * {{emailAddress}}, {{displayName}}, {{timeZone}} and {{locale}} might be null / masked depending on profile privacy settings

Please refer to [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/] for more information regarding user privacy changes.
{panel}
h3. Summary
{noformat}
GET /rest/servicedeskapi/organization/{organizationId}/user{noformat}
Using this API endpoint to retrieve customers returns duplicates across pages of paginated results.
h3. Environment
 * 150+ customers in org

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service desk project.
 # Create an organization.
 # Add 150 customers to this organization.
 # Run the following cURL:
{code:bash}
curl -X GET \
  'https://skahol.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/organization/5/user?limit=10&start=0' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: Basic <authToken>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 
{code}

 # Make note of the response.
 # Now run this cURL:
{code:bash}
curl -X GET \
  'https://skahol.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/organization/5/user?limit=10&start=11' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: Basic <authToken>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 
{code}

 # Make note again of this response.

h3. Expected Results

the results returned in each response should be different.
h3. Actual Results

Some of the same users are returned in each result set suggesting the order they are retrieved is not consistent meaning pagination does not work as expected.
h3. Notes

[The Jira Service Desk Cloud REST API - Get users in organization|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-organization-organizationId-user-get]
 [The Jira Service Desk Cloud REST API - Pagination|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#pagination]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pagination results are not consistent when retrieving customers who are part of an organization via the API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you have an open portal that allows not authenticated users to raise requests the field *Email confirmation to* is required, however, in case you didn't set any value on it, the system is returning the following error message.
{quote}(!) Couldn't send request
 Please copy your text, then refresh the page and try again. If you've already tried again, tell us about this issue.
{quote}
This message is generic and doesn't inform the real reason of why the issue wasn't created, the portal should display a specific error as it does with other required fields.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a portal without being logged.
 # Fill all the required fields but the *Email confirmation to*.
 # Click on *Send*.

h3. Expected Results

The system should display a message informing that the *Email confirmation to* is empty as it does with other required fields.

!summary.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The portal is displaying a message that makes no reference to the *Email confirmation to* field.

!Email confirmation to.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Not valid value in the Email confirmation to field on the portal should display a more specific message.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, it is not possible to share a workflow between request types so if different request types shares the same flow, each has to be configured individually
h3. Suggestion

Enable sharing workflows similar to workflow schemes in classic projects
fields.summary: Allow workflow sharing between request types

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Unable to customize the Priority list field for Jira Service Desk Next Gen

h3. Suggestion
Allow modification of the priorities list
fields.summary: Ability to modify the Priority list on Jira Service Desk Next Gen

fields.description:
Next-gen projects are the newest projects in Jira Service Desk. 


Our teams have totally reimagined the product to focus on making it easier to use and more powerful for modern software teams. In this new experience, software teams have more autonomy in the way they work while still delivering the power Jira administrators expect.

The Next-gen projects are already available for our customers but we are still working to deliver all functionalities we know from old times Jira in a simpler, more intuitive, and more consistent way.

In order to keep you as informed as possible, we're collecting missing features in this issue's subtasks. As features become available, we'll update the subtasks to let you know what's changed.
fields.summary: Next-gen Jira Service Desk Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you view subtasks in a queue, we are not displaying the parent request's key in the summary column.
h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a subtask.
 # Create a queue with a subtask visible in it, and with the Summary column.
 # View the queue screen.

h3. Expected Results

We should show the subtask's parent ticket's key at the start of the summary.
h3. Actual Results

We are only showing the summary text of the sub task.
h3. Workaround

You can either view your issues in the issue navigator, or click through from the queue to the subtask to see the parent key.
fields.summary: Summary in Queue not displaying parent ticket key

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , there's no documentation mention about for customer account that have Atlassian Account , their profile need to have the *Has access on site* option enable.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update [Manage Jira Service Desk customer accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html] documentation about this information. 

For example,
{panel}
Customer with Atlassian Account , in their profile need the *Has access on site* option enable.
{panel}

h3. Why this is important
This to make sure the site-admin understand how customer account worked.
fields.summary: Update "Manage Jira Service Desk customer accounts" documentation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Currently, accessing attachments would require the customer to login via the customer portal to download and view the content of the attachments

h3. Suggestion
Allow attachment to be embedded as in-line attachments for Email Notifications so that customer does not have to login via the portal in order to view the attachment.
fields.summary: Allow attachment to be embedded as in-line attachments for Email Notifications

fields.description:
It would be very helpful if the customer organization feature could support a hierarchy.

We have customers that provide / resell our service to third parties and it would be very helpful to have a concept like that in the organizations

I would like to be able to create an org layout like 

Company A is parent or controller of B and C

The idea being people in B and C could open ticket and only see things directly related to B or C but people in A should be able to see edit comment on everything in A, B and C.

Even going only one level deep for a hierarchy would be a giant improvement
fields.summary: Support an Organization hierarchy

fields.description:
h3. Issue

Snippet from spreadsheet added in an issue comment is not visible via the portal
h3. Steps to Replicate
 * Copy a set of cells from an excel file or any spreadsheet

 * Paste it as a comment in the issue comment (Agent view)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 * Check the same in the portal
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 Affects only the new issue view

h3. Expected result

The Spreadsheet cells ( columns and rows) should be visible in the portal view
h3. Current result

The cells are not visible in the portal view
h3. Workaround

Create table manually

Copy each cell from the original snippet to the table cells
fields.summary: Cells (columns and rows) copied from spreadsheet added in an issue comment not visible via the portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user is a customer involved and also is an agent in a project and a new comment is created mentioning this user, they will receive two notifications about it, one is an internal notification about the @mention and other is a Customer Notification about the new comment, however, since the user is a customer involved Jira should send just the customer notification.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Raise a request in a Service Desk project using an account that is also a Service Desk agent in the project.
# With another account, add a new external comment mentioning the reporter.
# The reporter will receive an internal Jira notification about the mention and also a Customer Notification about the new comment.

h3. Expected Results

The user should just be notified once.

h3. Actual Results

The user is receiving two notification about the same event, one as an internal Jira user and another one as a customer.

h3.Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: User should be notified once about a @mention when they are an agent and customer involved.

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}

At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Mail handler fails to attach a file to Jira issue if the file's name is unavailable such as due to:
 * filename is not specified
 * filename is improperly encoded

You can reproduce the problem with a scenario like:
 # Create a JSD project
 # Send an email inquiry which contains an attachment without specifying the file's name
 ** script: [^jpns27074.zip]

Then the exception below is thrown in the application log:
{code:none}
logger:	 com.atlassian.mail.converters.wiki.LinkAndImageHandler
message:	 Could not find attachment: '' () for content id: jira-generated-image-static-link_attachment_7-094e8593-fcd4-4916-966c-8b4a68745ec9
{code}

No error is recorded at product log:

 !Screenshot 2019-08-06 10.46.53.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

The file should be attached to the issue even without filename. The name can be something like timestamp or a sha1 fingerprint of the payload.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to upload attachment without filename via email

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing the Jira Service Desk configurations at https://<YourDomain>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa and clicking on the "Learn more about notifications" a 404 page is thrown.
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-29 at 12.23.57.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk configurations at https://<YourDomain>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to https://<YourDomain>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa;
# Click on "Learn more about notifications" link.

h3. Expected results

A page containing explanations about notifications should be shown.

h3. Actual result

A 404 page is thrown.


h3. Workaround

Access the correct link [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/set-up-notifications-for-your-customers-and-team/].
fields.summary: Link to “Learn more about notifications” in the URL /secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa throwing a 404 page

fields.description:
Automation rule to create an issue is not loading screen in Internet Explorer.

h3. Summary

When you're configuring the *Then do this...* option in an automation rule to *Create issue* the screen to set the information about the new issue is not loading when you're using Internet Explorer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new automation rule.
# Set a trigger in the *When this happens...*.
# In the *Then do this...* option, select *Create Issue*.
# The screen to set the values of the new ticket will not be displayed.

h3. Expected Results

The screen to set the new issue should be displayed as the following image.

 !IE.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

You can't set the information related to the issue that is going to be created.

 !Chrome.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

You could use a different browser as a workaround for this situation.

h3. Notes.

In our tests, we used the *11.829* IE version.
fields.summary: Automation rule to create an issue is not loading the screen in Internet Explorer.

fields.description:
Currently, when the customer permission to share request is restricted to *Other customers in their organization. This option only allows them to search for customers in their organization* the user picker filed works as expected. On the portal, the user picker field is limited to the members of the customer's organization:
 !customer.png|thumbnail! 

However, when an agent tries to report a request from the portal on behalf of the same customer, the user picker list is no longer restricted to the customer's organization but all customers.
 !agent on behalf of customer.png|thumbnail! 

As an Administrator, if we have multiple customers with the same name working in different organizations, to avoid issues we need a filtered user picker. Also sometimes the agents will be raising the request on behalf of the customer's, in that case, it gets more difficult to find the correct approver since there will be customers listed outside the customer's organization too.
fields.summary: Ability to filter/limit the user picker to members of reporter's customer Organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a Request have mandatory fields which are not filled, a generic error is displayed. It might not be useful since the users would have no idea of what is preventing the request from being created.
h3. Suggested Solution
Display an error which is referring to the those mandatory fields
fields.summary: Convey helpful messages when a request fails to create due to mandatory fields

fields.description:
Can Jira tickets cater to Release Management functionalities.

i.e. can we accommodate information in a jira ticket like it is a part of which version release (future or past versions).
fields.summary: JIRA Management in JSD

fields.description: Currently if you enter multiple approvers, only one of them needs to approve. We have situations where we need all the entered approvers to approve for the issue transitions to waiting for support. For example a purchase that will span multiple budgets: we want every budget authority to approve before the request transitions out of "waiting for approval".
fields.summary: Ability to require approvals from all approvers

fields.description:
Sometimes Jira administrator wants to set Attachment field as required for a few request types, however, that is currently not possible in Next-Gen projects.

At this time, this can be achieved in classic projects only.
fields.summary: Ability to set Attachment field as required in next-gen project request type

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

Some issue records, especially with high SLA values show incorrectly when exported to Microsoft Excel.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a Service Desk issue and leave it for a few days (works best this way)
 # In the Issue Navigator, add the 'Time to resolution' and 'Time waiting for support' fields. Search for the Service Desk issue, and take note of the values of those fields
 # Export the search results into Excel (tested with 'Current Fields'), and check the value for those fields.

h3. Expected Result
 Excel shows the correct value

h3. Actual Result
Excel displays an inverted value
 !Screenshot 2019-07-22 at 4.36.59 PM.png|width=586,height=290!
fields.summary: SLA values are incorrect when exported into Excel

fields.description:
h3. *Suggestion*

**Allow action request based on the context of the email subject

eg. Create Issue based on Request Types, Close Request, Freeze Request, etc...
fields.summary: Action request based on context of the email subject

fields.description:
Hi Jira team!

My name is Martin and I am from AVL Hungary.

We would like to have a new Jira interface for System Engineering Process Activities (overview for method groups and related people, etc.) and a new, simplfied PTC Integrity Modeler Support report page (with categories, reporter name, project setup etc). We would like to have also have some changes on ticket managing page (new workflow visualisation and issue states). What information do you need setup such new Interface? Please also share us a documentation, with all the expectation and requirements. 

Thank you in advance!

Best regards,
Martin
fields.summary: New JIRA interface for SEPA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment most of Jira Service Desk workflows have "Closed" issue status as a final one.
If you close a ticket, there is no way to reopen it without modifying a workflow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Service Desk project
 # Most of default workflows don't have option to "reopen" closed ticket

h3. Expected Results

There should be options from default workflows to have "reopen" transition.

h3. Workaround

You can add another reopen transition manually.
fields.summary: Default Service Desk workflows should have transition to reopen a ticket

fields.description: The changes made to allow updating certain field directly from within the queue , e.g. status has been wonderful so thanks for that. However, one thing that is missing is the ability to add a comment (internal or public) without having to go into the detailed view. I envision having a small comment button column where i could select either public or internal comment and have a modal popup.
fields.summary: As an Agent I would like to be able to add a comment on an issue directly from the queue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When issue creates from issue collector and tick for "Collect browser info" , the "Environment" field is not displaying at new issue view.

h3. Environment
Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue via issue collector and tick "Collect browser info"
# View issue from JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
Environment field display.

h3. Actual Results
There's no "Environment" field.

h3.Workaround
Change to old issue view
fields.summary: "Environment" is not displaying at "New issue view" when issue created via Issue collector

fields.description:
{panel}
{panel:title=Updated 13 November 2020}
We've confirmed that this behavior is reoccurring and have reopened this ticket.

Augusto Pasqualotto | Support Engineer, Jira Service Management Cloud
{panel}


h3. Summary

* Portal-only customer accounts do not have any configurable privacy options(Atlassian accounts do have configurable privacy options)
* For customer accounts - the expected behaviour is that:
-* Agents can see customer email addresses
-* Customers can see other customer email addresses if both have access to the same ticket/request

Calling either:
* <instance_name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search?jql=id=<issue_key>&expand=changelog&maxResults=1
* <instance_name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search?jql=id=<issue_key>
* <instance_name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/users/search?accountId=%

Doesn't return the {{emailAddress}} field for customer accounts as expected - the field is missing:
{noformat}
        "reporter": {
          "self": "https://dnguyen4-test3.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=qm%3Axxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxx",
          "name": "qm:xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxx",
          "key": "qm:xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxx",
          "accountId": "qm:xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxx",
          "avatarUrls": {
            "48x48": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=48&s=48",
            "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=24&s=24",
            "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=16&s=16",
            "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=32&s=32"
          },
          "displayName": "MyDisplayName",
          "active": true,
          "timeZone": "Europe/Amsterdam",
          "accountType": "customer"
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Call the instance to fetch issue data <instance_name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search?jql=id=<issue_key>
# Examine the response body

h3. Expected Results
* The response shows the {{emailAddress}} field
{noformat}
        "reporter": {
          "self": "https://dnguyen4-test3.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=qm%3Axxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxx",
          "name": "qm:xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxx",
          "key": "qm:xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxx",
          "accountId": "qm:xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxxxxx",
          "avatarUrls": {
            "48x48": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=48&s=48",
            "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=24&s=24",
            "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=16&s=16",
            "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=32&s=32"
          },
          "displayName": "MyDisplayName",
          "active": true,
          "timeZone": "Europe/Amsterdam",
          "accountType": "customer",
          "emailAddress": "myemailaddress@domain.invalid"
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
{{"emailAddress": "myemailaddress@domain.invalid"}} is missing from the response body
 
h3. Notes
* "Reporter" and "Request participants" field affected
* Possibly any other fields where the {{emailAddress}} field should be present

h3.Workaround
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: API: Unable to fetch customer email address via API
